variant.table: The FINITE STRING Newsletter Announcements Announcements THURSDAY, JUNE 17, 1982 4:00-5:00 P.M. ACL Business Meeting THURSDAY, JUNE 17, 1982 6:30-7:30 P.M. Conference Reception Faculty Club, 41 Wilcocks Street THURSDAY, JUNE 17, 1982 7:30 P.M. Conference Banquet and Presidential Address Faculty Club, 41 Wilcocks Street Jane J. Robinson, SRI International FRIDAY, JUNE 18, 1982 9:00-11:30 A.M. Contributed Papers Planning Natural Language Referring Expressions Douglas E. Appelt, SRI International The TEXT System for Natural Language Generation: An Overview Kathleen R. McKeown, University of Pennsylvania Salience: The Key to Selection in Deep Generation E. Jeffrey Conklin and David D. McDonald, University of Massachusetts FRIDAY, JUNE 18, 1982 1:00-2:00 P.M. Contributed Papers A Knowledge Engineering Approach to Natural Language Understanding Stuart C. Shapiro and Jeannette Neal, SUNY Buffalo A Model of Early Syntactic Development Pat Langley, Carnegie-Mellon University FRIDAY, JUNE 18, 1982 2:00-4:00 P.M. Panel Discussion Building Non-Normative Systems — The Search for Robustness
variant.affiliation: Mitchell Marcus (Chair), Bell Laboratories Robert J. Bobrow, Bolt Beranek and Newman Anthony Kroch, University of Pennsylvania Richard Granger, University of California at Irvine
variant.page: Stan C. Kwasny, Indiana University Lance A. Miller, IBM Research
variant.bodyText: The Ninth International Conference on Computation- al Linguistics (COLING 82) will be held July 5-10, 1982, in Prague, Czechoslovakia. It will be sponsored by the International Committee on Computational Linguistics, in association with the Linguistic Institute of L. Star, Slovak Academy of Science, Bratislava, and the Faculty of Mathematics and Physics, Charles Uni- versity, Prague. [See AJCL 7:2, pg. 122.1 For further information contact:
variant.equation: COLING 82 MFF UK, Linguistics Malostranske n. 25 118 00 Prague 1, CZECHOSLOVAKIA
variant.bodyText: The 1982 European Conference on Artificial Intelligence will be held July 12-14, 1982, in Orsay, France (just after COLING-82). The conference is sponsored by the Society for the Study of Artificial Intelligence and the Simulation of Behavior (AISB). [See AJCL 7:3, pg. 182.] General inquiries about the conference should be addressed to: Yves Kodratoff, General Chairman Institut de programmation 4, Place Jussieu F-75230 Paris Cedex 05, France 33-1-329 12 21, ext. 53-90 The Second National Conference on Artificial Intelligence sponsored by the American Association for Artificial Intelligence (AAAI), in cooperation with ACM SIGART, will be held August 18-20, 1982, at The University of Pittsburgh and Carnegie-Mellon University in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. There will also be a two-day Tutorial Program August 16-17. [See AJCL 7:4, pg. 265.] For additional information con- tact:
variant.table: Louis F. Robinson American Assoc. for A.I. 445 Burgess Drive Menlo Park, California 94025 (415) 328-3123
variant.bodyText: The 1982 ACM Symposium on LISP and Functional Programming will be held in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, on August 16-19, 1982. The symposium is sponsored by the ACM Special Interest Groups on Programming Languages (SIGPLAN), Automata and Computability (SIGACT), and Artificial Intelligence (SIGART). [See AJCL 7:4, pg. 265.] The local arrangements chairman is:
variant.table: American Journal of Computational Linguistics, Volume 8, Number 1, January-March 1982 47 The FINITE STRING Newsletter Announcements Guy L. Steele, Jr. Computer Science Department Carnegie-Mellon University Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania 15213
variant.bodyText: EUROMICRO 82 is the eighth annual symposium organized by EUROMICRO, the European Associa- tion for Microprocessing and Microprogramming. It will be held September 5-9, 1982, in Haifa, Israel. [See AJCL 7:4, pg. 266.] The deputy program chair- man is:
variant.figure: L. Richter University of Dortmund-Informatik III P.O. Box 500 500 D-4600 Dortmund WEST GERMANY (49) (231) 7552780 The 1982 International Conference of the Chinese- Language Computer Society will be held September 22-23, 1982 (during COMPCON week), in Washing- ton, D.C. [See AJCL 7:4, pg. 265.] For further in- formation, contact: Professor C.Y. Suen Program Chairman Department of Computer Science Concordia University 1455 de Maisonneuve West Montreal, Quebec H3G 1M8, CANADA
variant.bodyText: The Sixth German Workshop on Artificial Intelli- gence (GWAI-82) will be held in Bad Honnef (Physikzentrum, HauptstraBe 5, D-5340 Bad Honnef), September 27 - October 1, 1982. The workshop is organized by the special interest group on artificial intelligence in the Gesellschaft fur Informatik (GI). [See AJCL 7:4, pg. 265.] The chairman is:
variant.figure: Dr. Wolfgang Wahlster FB Informatik University of Hamburg SchluterstraBe 70 D-2000 Hamburg 13 WEST GERMANY (040) 4123 3315
variant.bodyText: The Linguistics Program at the University of Dela- ware has announced the Delaware Symposium on Lan- guage Studies IV, to take place October 14-16, 1982, at the University of Delaware. [See AJCL 7:4, pg. 266.] For further information about the program, contact: Dr. Stephanie Williams Department of Languages and Literature University of Delaware Newark, Delaware 19711 The American Society for Information Science's 45th Annual Meeting (ASIS-82) will be held in Columbus, Ohio, October 17-21, 1982. [See AJCL 7:4, pg. 266.] For more information, contact:
variant.figure: John Fried - Room CA ASIS-82 Technical Program Chairman Battelle Columbus Laboratories 505 King Avenue Columbus, Ohio 43201
variant.bodyText: Georgia Institute of Technology will host a Sympo- sium on Empirical Foundations of Information and Software Science on November 3-5, 1982, in Atlanta, Georgia. Co-sponsors of the Symposium are the Spe- cial Interest Group for Foundations of Information Science (SIG/FIS) of the American Society of Infor- mation Science and the Army Institute for Research in Management Information and Computer Science (AIRMICS). [See AJCL 7:4, pg. 266.] All inquiries and other correspondence regarding the Symposium should be addressed to: Professor Pranas Zunde Chairman, Symposium Organizing Committee School of Information and Computer Science Georgia Institute of Technology Atlanta, Georgia 30332 The Association for Literary and Linguistic Computing will hold its 1983 Meeting in San Francis- co, California, April 6-8, 1983. The deadline for pa- per proposals for the meeting is September 30, 1982. [See _AWL 7:4, pg. 264.] For further information contact:
variant.reference: 2000 Center Street, Suite 1036 Berkeley, California 94704 (415) 621-6415 The next International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence (IJCAI-83) will be held in Karlsruhe, West Germany, during the week of August 8-12, 1983. [See AJCL 7:4, pg. 265.] For further information, contact: Saul Amarel Computer Science Department Hill Center/Busch Campus Rutgers University New Brunswick, New Jersey 08903 (201) 932-3546
variant.page: 48 American Journal of Computational Linguistics, Volume 8, Number 1, January-March 1982
